title: Job Openings at Caring Habitat
content:
Caring Habitat is a 40-room purpose-built inpatient skilled nursing and rehabilitation hospital designed to complement the health outcomes of patients through the delivery robust rehabilitation program.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Care Assistant

Job Location: Abraham Adesanya, Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Brief Description
     

            
    




	We are an In-patient Nursing and Rehabilitation facility committed to supporting individuals on their journey to wellness and recovery.
	We require dynamic, self motivated and driven care givers in addition to our team to help render specialized care tailored to the health needs of our esteemed patients.
	The role of the Care Assistant is to provide for the daily care, comfort, safety, and health needs of patient


Responsibilities
To provide patient care, the Caregiver assists the patient with:


	Rendering personal care; bed bathing and or assisted bathroom bath.
	Eating (support patient during feed-time).
	Change patient’s soiled diapers, Incopad, slide sheet and bed linen.
	Assist patient use the convenience.
	Transferring patient using the Glide/Slide sheet and hoist to facilitate ambulating.
	Communication: Identify patient’s hobbies and often engage them in activities that is of interest to him/her, example, play games, watch television programs, play music that patient love listening to, miming, storytelling, et-cetera.


To provide for patient comfort, the Caregiver, should:


	Create a positive home-like environment by responding to patient’s need promptly, respect his/her privacy.
	Help patient develop trust.
	Patient’s confidentiality is vital. However, if information received will cause harm to patient, colleague, family member or lead to adverse event, please EXPLAIN why it is IMPORTANT to escalate such information.
	Offer emotional support and work with the family: show empathy and use appropriate word peculiar to patient’s condition.
	Communicate effectively and actively listen.


To provide for patient safety, the caregiver, must:


	Follow Infection Prevention /Control practices: using personal protective equipment such as face mask, hand glove, when hands are visibly soiled with patient body fluid, wash hands with soap under running water before and after attending to patients, and or use hand sanitizer, proper waste segregation, putting soiled and dirty clothes in separate laundry bags.
	Maintain a clean, safe environment and report safety problems immediately.
	Perform procedures correctly, following, “Standard of Practice” example, bed or assisted, bathroom bath, oral care, patient feeding, 2-hourly changing of patient’s position, preparing wound dressing gauze.


Requirements
The ideal candidate must possess the following requirements:


	A Care giver's certificate.
	1-3 Years of working experience as a care giver.
	Must reside around Lekki-Ajah axis due to proximity.


Benefits


	Salary: N75,000 Monthly (Net).
	Leave Allowance
	HMO
	Pension.


Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: caringhabitatgl@gmail.com using "Care Assistant" as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Driver

Job Location: Abraham Adesanya, Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking for a driver who will be responsible for the safe and timely transportation of [patients/staff/goods/equipment] to designated locations.
	This role requires excellent driving skills, a strong understanding of traffic laws, and a commitment to providing exceptional service.


Key Responsibilities


	Safely and efficiently operate company vehicles (cars, ambulance).
	Plan and follow the most efficient routes to ensure timely arrivals and deliveries, considering traffic and road conditions.
	Conduct pre-trip and post-trip vehicle inspections to ensure vehicles are in good working condition.
	Report any mechanical issues, accidents, or incidents promptly to the appropriate supervisor.
	Maintain accurate records of mileage, fuel consumption, deliveries, and other relevant information.
	Adhere to all traffic laws, road safety regulations, and company policies.
	Ensure the cleanliness and maintenance of the assigned vehicle.
	Assist with loading and unloading [goods/equipment], if required.
	Maintain a professional and courteous demeanor.
	Handle cash or payment transactions, if applicable, and ensure accurate record-keeping.
	Perform other duties as assigned by the supervisor.


Qualifications


	A Primary school leaving certificate or SSCE.
	At least 4-5 years of Driving Experience.
	Valid Driver’s license.
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
	Excellent communication and customer service skills.
	Good knowledge of the Lagos road network.
	Ability to navigate traffic using google map.
	Good knowledge of road signs and Lagos state traffic law.


Pay packages


	Net pay of 100,000
	Accommodation
	HMO
	Performance incentive
	Leave benefits
	Pension.


Application Closing Date: 30th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: caringhabitatgl@gmail.com using "Driver" as the subject of the mail.

Note: Candidates must reside within Lekki and environs.

 

 

3.) Nurse Assistant Trainer

Job Location: Abraham Adesanya, Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Part-time

Job Description


	We are a Nurse Assistant training school in need of a knowledgeable, certified and motivated trainer, who can teach our students up to date safe and timely clinical practices in line with the Internationally acceptable medical practices.


This job role is a part time role, candidates are expected to demonstrate knowledge of the following courses:


	Foundations of Healthcare
	Basic Medical Knowledge
	Patient Care and Therapeutic Support
	Medication and Safety
	Emergency Response
	Specialized Care.


Qualifications Required


	B.Sc / HND in Nursing or any other related discipline
	At least 2 years of experience as an Nursing assistant trainer.


Salary
N150,000 - N300,000 / month

Application Closing Date: 25th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: caringhabitatgl@gmail.com using "Nurse Assistant Trainer" as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Openings at Fiphs Infrastructure Limited
content:
Fiphs Infrastructure Limited is an Engineering, Procurement and Construction Company with extensive local knowledge, engineering and construction expertise. We deliver innovative and creative solutions that provide our stakeholders with the highest possible level of expertise, exceeding their expectation using cutting edge technology to provide services covering planning, design, engineering, construction, operation and maintenance.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Quality Assurance / Quality Control (QA/QC) Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Roles / Objectives
     

            
    




	A construction company is seeking an experienced QA/QC Manager to oversee all quality assurance and control activities across projects and the organization.
	The role involves managing the company’s Quality Management System (QMS), ensuring compliance with industry standards, and driving continuous improvement to meet project specifications.


Position Overview / Responsibilities


	Ensure compliance procedures, systems, and controls are current and effectively implemented.
	Maintain and regularly update the compliance manual and all procedure documentation.
	Develop and review Standards of Conduct to guide management and staff appropriately.
	Develop and implement project-specific quality assurance programs based on ISO 9001:2015.
	Prepare and monitor project QA/QC budgets to ensure efficient resource allocation.
	Oversee and ensure effective implementation of quality control programs on projects.
	Monitor project material usage along against design and specification requirements.
	Manage project quality compliance with codes, standards, regulations, and contractual requirements.
	Identify and facilitate certification and training requirements for QA/QC personnel.
	Manage comprehensive QA/QC documentation, including certificates, calibration records, test results, inspection requests, non-compliance reports, site instructions, and materials records.
	Develop and maintain written quality assurance and control procedures.
	Conduct on-site and laboratory testing to confirm material and work conformity.
	Establish and maintain standard documentation and processes for construction quality management.
	Analyze quality data to proactively address issues and recommend solutions.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Civil Engineering or any relevant field.
	5 - 7 years of relevant experience in quality management and compliance monitoring.
	Registered with a recognized professional engineering or QA/QC association.
	Strong knowledge of (ISO 9001:2015) quality management standards
	Proficient in MS Word, Excel, and familiar with AutoCAD and Primavera software.
	Experience in project planning, execution (construction realities), and cross-functional communication.
	Skilled in managing non-conformance, deficiency reporting programs, and root cause analysis.
	Self-motivated, professional, and proactive approach to quality management.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV attached with a Passport Photograph, Degree Certificate, NYSC Certificate and any other professional / relevant certificates to: recruitment@fiphs.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Health, Safety & Environment (HSE)

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Role/ Objectives


	We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) Professional to lead and manage all HSE functions across our organization.
	The ideal candidate will drive the development and implementation of strategic safety systems, ensure full regulatory compliance, and maintain the company’s HSE Management System.


Position Overview/Responsibilities


	Develop and conduct regular HSE training programs and orientation sessions on safety laws, hazard control, and the proper use of safety equipment.
	Investigate and document construction incidents, including accidents, near-misses, and occupational injuries; identify root causes and implement preventive measures.
	Conduct safety audits and site inspections of equipment, tools, and worksites to ensure compliance with internal and external safety standards. Correct potential hazards.
	Monitor worksites and company facilities to ensure compliance with company HSE policies and government regulations.
	Recommend corrective actions and oversee the implementation of quick-response systems for on-site/off-site incidents.
	Develop and implement project-specific HSE procedures and risk assessments
	Ensure compliance with ISO 45001:2018 and ISO 14001:2015 standards across all project sites.
	Maintain proper safety documentation and regularly update the HSE Management System.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Science, or any relevant HSE discipline.
	Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in HSE roles, preferably within the construction industry.
	HSE certifications such as NEBOSH or equivalent (mandatory)
	In-depth knowledge of ISO 45001:2018 and ISO 14001:2015 standards.
	Excellent communication and leadership skills.
	Strong interpersonal skills for engaging with management and cross-functional teams.
	Proficient in MS Office and engineering software.
	Passionate about workplace health and safety, and committed to developing a culture of safety within the company.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, attached with a Cover Letter, passport photograph, Degree Certificate, NYSC Certificate and any other professional/relevant certificates in one (1) email to: recruitment@fiphs.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Laboratory Technician (Civil)

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Role/ Objectives


	A Construction Company is seeking a young, dynamic Laboratory Technician to support project planning, design, and execution by conducting sampling, testing, verification, and validation of construction materials.
	The successful candidate will ensure all materials comply with project quality standards and specifications.


Position Overview / Responsibilities


	Collect construction material samples in accordance with the approved quality plan
	Assist in the analysis of raw materials, intermediate and finished samples to verify compliance with specifications.
	Perform construction sample testing, including sieve analysis and moisture content determination.
	Identify and promptly report deviations from quality standards to the QA/QC Officer and Project Engineer.
	Recommend and implement improvements to laboratory operations and maintenance of equipment and instruments.
	Prepare and submit periodic laboratory analysis and activity reports.
	Maintain effective housekeeping and safety practices within the laboratory.
	Assist in maintenance ISO quality management systems within the laboratory unit.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Civil Engineering or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in civil/building industry.
	Practical experience with soil tests, concrete tests and bitumen testing is highly desirable
	Proficient in operating modern laboratory equipment and applying industry sampling standards
	Ability to follow procedures accurately, efficiently and safely.
	Competent computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
	Demonstrated commitment to workplace safety.
	A personal commitment to continuous self-development.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV attached with a passport photograph, Degree Certificate, NYSC Certificate and any other professional/relevant certificates in one (1) email to: recruitment@fiphs.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
